newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican Cetes less attractive - Bear Stearns.
newsitem.headline: Mexican Cetes less attractive - Bear Stearns.

text.p: Mexican Cetes (Treasury Certificates) appear less attractive at current levels but still offer value, Bear Stearns said in its most recent Latin Value report.
"We prefer the 91-day and 342-day Cetes over other maturities," the company said.
"The 182-day maturities still look somewhat attractive but would mature immediately after the July 6 mid-term elections, a point when political uncertainty may be at its peak," it said.
Rates on bellwether 28-day Cetes fell five basis points to 22.93 percent at Tuesday night's primary auction this week.
Rates on 91- and 182-day Cetes fell 27 and five basis points, respectively, to 24.16 percent and 24.63 percent.
The 342-day Cetes rate was 25.86 percent, compared with 25.54 percent for the 349-day paper last week.
